name: reconcentrate
content:
reconcentrate verb [T]
(COME TOGETHER)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to bring something together again in a large number or amount in one particular area: By reconcentrating widely dispersed households in larger villages, the government sought to deny the rebels access to food and supplies. They have re-concentrated powers in the hands of the administration.
More examplesFewer examples Moths disperse in transit, and must be reconcentrated before they lay their eggs.They are reconcentrating subsidized housing instead of trying to distribute it across the metropolitan area.He returned to the city to re-concentrate his now dangerously scattered army.

reconcentrate verb [T]
(MAKE STRONGER)
chemistry
  specialized to make a liquid or substance stronger and reduce its size again, by removing water from it: All filtrates were pooled and re-concentrated as described above. Every animal grows by re-concentrating elements previously dispersed in surrounding plants or other animals.
More examplesFewer examplesThe resulting solution was diluted and re-concentrated.A large volume of saline was added to the concentrated fluid and it was reconcentrated by ultrafiltration twice.The fluids obtained were reconcentrated.
